image.altText: A medical pen being held by a woman.

props.synopsis: The pharmaceutical giants behind Wegovy and Mounjaro have recently launched advertisements directing people towards their doctor for weight loss. Some experts warn this type of advertising may affect public health messaging.

title.children: Weight-loss drug manufacturers under fire for 'unethical' ads

image.altText: World Leaders Donald Trump and Xi Jinping stand together.

props.synopsis: There was something Donald Trump said that alarmed strategic analysts. And it had nothing to do with disliking Kevin Rudd.

title.children: Trump said something that alarmed analysts. It had nothing to do with Rudd

image.altText: A mother and her two children play with plastic toys on the floor of a home.

props.synopsis: Microplastics are everywhere, including our bodies and brains, and the exposure risk may be highest within our own homes.

title.children: The pollutant found in homes that is stoking health fears

image.altText: A man hoses down dirt at a mining site

props.synopsis: America dominates the global financial system. The Middle East controls energy. And China, during the past 40 years, has created a vice-like grip on the mining, refining and production of global metals.

title.children: Why the US and Australia are partnering on rare earths

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera smiling with her 10-month-old baby whose face is pixalated in this photo.

props.synopsis: As the European Union proposes a ban on the entire PFAS chemical class, some researchers say Australia should do the same.

title.children: Calls for Australia to follow Europe's push to ban 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: A man dressed in a wetsuit stands on a boat.

props.synopsis: It is estimated half of the local seagrass habitat in Gamay (Botany Bay) has already been lost. Researchers and Aboriginal rangers are replanting seagrass fragments and using biochar to restore the area.

title.children: 'Localised extinction' risk for seagrass in Botany Bay

image.altText: Prince Andrew in ceremonial clothes looks out a rainy window

props.synopsis: Sir Keir Starmer has told British parliament he supports scrutiny of Crown property deals but getting Prince Andrew to answer questions at Westminster might not be easy.

title.children: UK PM backs calls for Prince Andrew to face MPs over Royal Lodge deal

image.altText: Two teenage girls alongside polaroid-style pictures of gymnastic performances

props.synopsis: Gymnasts as young as 13 say they were bullied, fat-shamed and humiliated at a Queensland gymnastics club, then forced out when their families complained.

title.children: Gymnasts allege body shaming, humiliation, before being forced out

image.altText: A dark-haired, bearded man in a sports tracksuit holds an Israeli flag while raising his arms in triumph.

props.synopsis: The world's most populous Muslim nation refused to issue visas to Israeli athletes last week because of the war in Gaza.

title.children: Indonesia's ban on Israeli athletes sparks backlash from IOC

image.altText: A long queue of people stretches along a footpath outside a large city building.

props.synopsis: Precious metal prices have been pushing record highs and, as queues lengthened outside bullion traders, gold and silver prices suddenly fell back. But positive signs remain, analysts say.

title.children: Amid rush on precious metals, have the gold and silver bubbles popped?

image.altText: A helicopter hovers in a grey sky as a person hangs from a line above white capped water.

props.synopsis: Two men have died after being winched from rough waters off Frankston as much of the state recorded wind gusts over 90 kph during a severe weather system.

title.children: Two dead after being pulled from water during Victoria's wild weather

image.altText: A drone shot of a construction project near the ocean, cranes and other industrial equipment are on-site.

props.synopsis: A "climate trigger" that could be used to block coal and gas projects has been formally excluded from the government's overhaul of Australia's environment laws, minister Murray Watt confirms.

title.children: 'Climate trigger' formally ruled out of environment laws

image.altText: A photo of two Samsung Galaxy7 smartphones

props.synopsis: Some Samsung mobile phone users may be unable to call triple-0 in an emergency after Telstra announced testing had revealed more than 70 models were not connecting correctly.

title.children: Some Samsung phones unable to make triple-0 calls

image.altText: Supporters of the legal action outside court in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The mother of a trans teenager launched legal action over the state's freeze on puberty blockers earlier this year.

title.children: Queensland court reserves decision on puberty blocker ban

image.altText: Orange virus particles on a white and green dotted background

props.synopsis: Mpox transmission surged between July to September last year, but there have been far fewer cases recorded in 2025.

title.children: Why Australia has confirmed far fewer mpox cases this year

image.altText: A close up of Matildas coach Joe Montemurro's face with the Australian flag on a big screen in the background

props.synopsis: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro has no shortage of ideas or passion for how to reshape women's football in Australia, and it's a contrast from his predecessor.

title.children: ‘We need to do more’: Matildas coach outlines vision for women's game

image.altText: A man is arrested by police and handcuffed

props.synopsis: Three men charged over a machete brawl outside Melbourne's Luna Park have been freed on bail, despite police urging magistrates to keep the trio locked up.

title.children: 'Grow up fast': Magistrates release men after Luna Park machete brawl

image.altText: P8 Poseidon

props.synopsis: Beijing ramps up criticisms of Australia over a tense military encounter over the South China Sea on Sunday, accusing the Australian Defence Force of distributing "twisted and absurd propaganda" and "provoking" China.

title.children: China increases criticism after tense military encounter between planes

image.altText: Hannah Thomas with glasses outside court.

props.synopsis: The police officer charged with allegedly assaulting former Greens candidate Hannah Thomas is now facing an additional, more serious, offence.

title.children: Police officer charged with extra offence over Hannah Thomas arrest

image.altText: Two men in suits speak.

props.synopsis: The official will participate in planning and coordination efforts related to humanitarian and security challenges in implementing the ceasefire.

title.children: Australian official to join Trump's Gaza peace taskforce

image.altText: A man holds up a phone while he takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: A NSW man has claimed to be an admiral for 25 years while peddling a disaster relief scheme, but he has never served in the navy.

title.children: Colourful past of 'admiral' peddling disaster relief scheme exposed

image.altText: A close-up of fresh fish for sale at a market.

props.synopsis: There are microplastics in almost everything, so why does seafood get such a bad reputation? Scientists say it is down to disproportionate research and media attention.

title.children: Microplastics 'misconception' hurting seafood sector, scientists say

image.altText: A blonde, middle-aged woman in a pastel blazer walks in a large building.

props.synopsis: After a Liberal colleague calls Sussan Ley's claim that Kevin Rudd cannot remain US ambassador "churlish", the opposition leader walks back from her call.

title.children: Sussan Ley backtracks on call for Kevin Rudd to be sacked as US ambassador

image.altText: A woman wearing a dress, holding her partner's hand as she walks towards the courthouse.

props.synopsis: A defamation trial over a press release issued by Northern Territory senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has been derailed by an "unusual and significant" application to have a man barred from the court.

title.children: Senator’s defamation trial derailed over bid to have man excluded from court

image.altText: A white tent seen alongside a carpark, with bright orange flames and a large dark smoke plume erupting from its roof

props.synopsis: One person has been detained and at least one person injured after a shooting and a fire broke out outside of Serbia's parliament in Belgrade, in an incident that President Aleksandar Vučić has called a terrorist act.

title.children: Serbian president calls shooting outside parliament a 'terrorist act'

image.altText: A greyhound with a cast on its hind leg lies on a blanket.

props.synopsis: Staff at Greyhound Racing SA accuse the organisation of suppressing complaints about its preferred vet, according to documents and graphic photos tabled in state parliament.

title.children: Vet sent greyhounds home with 'open wounds', SA parliament told

image.altText: Cricketer celebrates a wicket with a high five, being approached by a teammate

props.synopsis: Led by stand-in captain Tahlia McGrath, Australia will seek to re-establish itself at the top of the Women's Cricket World Cup standings.

title.children: Australia vs England, Women's Cricket World Cup, live scores and stats

image.altText: A glass cabinet with a silver tiara with green gems on it

props.synopsis: INTERPOL has circulated a "special edition poster" alerting police worldwide to "priceless" stolen Louvre jewels, which French authorities have valued at $157 million.

title.children: INTERPOL issues worldwide alert for 'priceless' stolen Louvre jewels

image.altText: A brown plush monster doll keychain hung on a brown bag.

props.synopsis: Police seize Labubu dolls found during a search at a property in Melbourne's west. The dolls, worth an estimated $9,000, were allegedly stolen from a CBD shopping centre.

title.children: Man arrested in Melbourne after police seize dozens of Labubu dolls

image.altText: Stanley Obi

props.synopsis: The mother of a woman who allegedly broke into her former partner’s home and set it alight, before dying in the fire herself, gives evidence at a coronial inquest.

title.children: Mother of woman who allegedly set ex-partner alight appears at inquest

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair sits with crossed arms outside a blue office building with three steps

props.synopsis: A viral video showing a lack of accessibility into the offices of the federal minister for disability has highlighted broader issues for access into public buildings, an advocate says.

title.children: Advocate says federal disability minister's office is inaccessible

image.altText: Police launched a manhunt for the three individuals.

props.synopsis: Three men forced to cling to an esky to survive in wild seas off Albany as they tried to import hundreds of kilograms of cocaine into Western Australia are described by a judge as "Keystone criminals" at their sentencing.

title.children: Bungling drug smugglers found clinging to esky in wild seas jailed

image.altText: A painting of a large echidna, kangaroo, thylacine and wombat-like creature in an eucalypyt forest.

props.synopsis: Palaeontologists say there is no hard evidence in the fossil record that extinct Australian megafauna were butchered by First Nations people.

title.children: Did humans kill Australia's ancient megafauna? Bone study prompts rethink
